intro: Euphorbia briquetii, commonly known as the Briquet’s spurge, is a succulent plant native to the Canary Islands. It features a short, woody stem with dense clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, aiding in water storage. It is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Euphorbia briquetii is known for its resilience and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance.
